Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Yvonnelelo
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern well run hotel close to the main shopping area along the Ku Dam and close to U Bahn connections. Food - both breakfast and evening meal (Portugese menu) were excellent. Staff friendly and helpful e.g. found a charger for my Iphone Rooms were immaculate Definitely a place to go to again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family, great location”
Reviews.Author: upglider22
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel two times in december of 2011. We have a two bedroom apartment, which is great. The hotel site doesn't menshion 2 bathrooms and fully equiped kitchen. Location is 5 minutes walking to Ku-dam shoping district and a U Bahn station in front of hotel. We liked that much that we return for a second time in the same month with our parents! The stlye of rooms is great, prices reasonable and the staff is friendly. We would certainly make a return trip this year.

Reviews.Title: “New, very modern and an excellent value”
Reviews.Author: HLPCS
Reviews.Content: Sana Berlin Hotel, a part of a Portugese hotel chain, has only been open since December 2010. As a result, it is less known and visited than many other 4 star hotels in Berlin. As a result you can be offered a rate as low as $100 per night including breakfast and all taxes--an unheard of rate for a comparable hotel in Berlin. What do you get or this bargain--an ultra modern, comfortable and friendly stay with a superb breakfast and an excellent, if largely ignored restaurant. The hotel is located slightly away from major commercial areas such as the Kurfürstendamm, but a short walk takes you to KadeWe and dozens of restaurants and there is a subway stop one block away. Sana Hotel Berlin is by far the best value I have seen in my trips to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel very close to Ku-damm, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: thomas68_nl
Reviews.Content: This design hotel is very new and the rooms and facilities accordingly are in excellent condition. We stayed for a romantic couple-weekend in Berlin and got a special price of 112 Euro per night including an excellent breakfast. We would certainly go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent design hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fckbst
Reviews.Content: I am very positive for this hotel for couple of reasons. Most of all design, than location 3-5 mins away of real center Kudamm, clean and nice staff In restaurant. Even very good choise of great wines. Nice pool, unfortunately sauna was cold :-( If you book not directly, but through third parties, pay attantion for any changes you possibly can make later!!! Reception is not even able or has no goodwill..? to give you whatever else if you ask for non used night :-( I felt like dump when they even ask for a night extra to pay. (we should spend 2times 2 doubles and spent only 3times 1 double room) i would expect at least breakfast or WiFi free of charge if we cant spend All nights and not to be asked to pay one night extra! But I like this hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “Yes, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ViajeroNegocio
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a modern hotel in the western part of Berlin, walking distance from Ku´Damm, this could be your choice. Staff was friendly and correct, rooms spacious, new and modern (a bit too modern for my taste, but that is a personal question) and I can only praise the quality of the breakfast. Amazing from my point of view the possibility to have breakfast on the weekends up to 14:00 hours (yes it's true, you read correctly, up to 2 p.m, it's not a joke) I think that is a superb service and a big competitive plus, it gives one the possibility to convert breakfast into a brunch, and I was not the only one to do so... Overall a good hotel experience, nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Supperb Staff!”
Reviews.Author: JamWP
Reviews.Content: The best thing at Sana Berlin is its staff. Everybody, no exception made, are very, very nice and courteous. The hotel is new, rooms are simple but modern and well deccored. Found the pillows a bit hard. Breakfast was excellent. Missed only the regular "ham". Location is good and central. The only "bad" comment is regarding the TV. Only german channels and one or two in english. All in all I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Let me add my "Great Hotel!" review”
Reviews.Author: PatrickCA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September 2011 and I'm looking forward to my next visit in April 2012. I stayed in one of the two room apartments and it was a very large apartment with full kitchen and even a washer/dryer combo. Modern and sleek definitely describe this hotel. And as everyone points out the price is very reasonable and competitive. A great hotel to base your tour of Berlin. Public transit is famously efficient in Berlin and with a subway stop right out front, you're never far from any spot in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with a few faults...”
Reviews.Author: Fraser59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sana Hotel as a couple on a 5 day city break a few weeks ago and don’t let the fact I’ve only gave it three stars put you off. It is a decent four star hotel but fails on a couple of pretty basic points. The hotel is situated near the main shopping area and you are never far away from a u-bahn (subway) station at any given time letting you explore the city easily and at your leisure. It cost about €45 to the hotel from the airport by taxi and check in was fast and efficient. Don’t expect a view as the hotel is in the middle of a residential area which isn’t really a problem as the area also hosts a couple of great restaurants within walking distance. The rooms are large with a large comfy bed and the large glass screen that separates the sleeping area from the shower and toilet area may be a nice touch for some while the lack of privacy may be an issue for others. The Hotel is quite dark with low lighting inside and was always warm whether in the bedroom or bar / reception areas. All in all I would have had no problems giving the Sana four stars but for the following issues that may or may not have any bearing on if you wish to stay there or not. First thing was that there was no complimentary bottled water on arrival. The tap water may be okay to drink but there is nothing in the room to clarify on this. In almost every hotel in the world I have travelled to and stayed in free complimentary bottled water is provided. There are two small bottles of water in the mini bar which we used until we found a local shop but at €3.oo each it feels like a bit of a fleece. You can also take up the option of breakfast at €12.50 each where bottles of water were provided to breakfast diner’s foc. We took the breakfast option when we stayed but I would only qualify it as average fare and a bit over priced. He second issue I had was with the tv channels available, again some English speaking were advertised but only one was available and that was the Australasia version of CNN?? go figure. So if you want to keep up with current news back in the UK your options within the hotel are limited to say the least. Again not a deal breaker for everyone but as before I get more English language tv stations in almost any other hotel than the options at the Sana. Failing to have any tv to watch after a long day touring around you can always catch up on emails and the web. That is if your prepared to pay €12.oo a day or €60.oo for a week of wi-fi at the hotel. No thanks. Like I have said, the Sana is a good hotel but just lets itself down on some basic issues that if rectified I would have no problems giving it 4 stars instead of 3. Berlin is a fantastic place to visit and we’ll be back as we’d love to see the place in the summertime. Just don’t know if we’d stay at the Sana again?

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, with friendly staff on a nice spot.”
Reviews.Author: Erik1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 3 nights in this comfortable and very clean hotel. We had a nice bathroom with great rain shower. The staff is friendly and you can enjoy a good breakfast. The spa is nice and the kids loved the (small) pool.The hotel is close to the Kurfurstendam and just a few minutes away from the underground (U-bahn) station Spichernstr (or the U9 or U3) or Augsburgerstr (U3) which is across the street.So sightseeing Berlin is easy. For public transportation use the Berlin Welcome card. You can get it at the hotel and the staff can give you further information. If you want to visit the Reichstag, you need a ticked! So remember to book at least 3 days in advance on the website of the bundestag.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient for Business or vacations”
Reviews.Author: Giorgos1331
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to visit West Berlin on feet (Zoo, Kurfunstendamm Str. etc) if you accommodate on this hotel. Metro startion is 2 minutes away by feet and you can take the U3 line for transfer of the next one (using U2 line, you can go to the East part if Berlin). The breakfast was perfect. A lot of different tastes and fine quality. The hotel is very quiet even the reason that it is located into the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy & clean”
Reviews.Author: KILLE10
Reviews.Content: I truly recommend this hotel as it has nice rooms with options of rooms size.. Area is also very good with only short walk to Ku´dam!

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: bloke_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the SANA in Berlin and it was very pleasant. Ultra-modern decor but friendly ambience made better by the welcoming staff. Lunch in the restaurant was very well prepared but a little pricey - the room was however a very reasonable price. WiFi, as often, was too expensive. Travelling on business means that I have to mark this hotel down for one thing - the beautifully decorated room with excellent sound and TV was poorly designed to work in. The desk was too small and set partly in the wall making working claustrophobic. There didn't seem to be a light on the desk either - unless it was well hidden. Perfect for the U-bahn station, and close enough to the slightly worn restaurants and shops of the Ku'damm. I'll be going back to the SANA.

Reviews.Title: “Ultramodern Experience”
Reviews.Author: j_debruyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at SANA for five days over New Years Eve, and it was such a great choice. We initially booked a superior room but eventually decided to pay a little extra and book a suite. The suite was very spacious, clean and modern with a large bathroom, two toilets and a lounge area. There is also a great deal of storage space, meaning you don't have to live out of your suitcase. I loved the modern design and the room was impeccably clean and well presented. The hotel was well located only a few blocks from the Kurfurstendamm shopping precinct and also 10 minutes walk in the opposite direction from the gay area of Motzsrasse/Fuggerstrasse, which other than the usual bars, contains a range of small boutique shops and restaurants. I strongly recommend a small restaurant called Sissi, although it would pay to book in advance. The hotel also contained a small pool, gym and sauna which was clean and modern, and a great way to relax after a busy day sightseeing. The only complaint I can offer is that the room didn't contain tea or coffee making facilities. But overall I would definitely stay in this hotel when I return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “3 good nights for the Berlin Half Marathon 2011”
Reviews.Author: tinyhunter
Reviews.Content: I booked this as I was in town for the Half Marathon and wanted something new. I was not disappinted. Big room nice open bathroom. Clean good location and good service at breakfast time. Wi stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: FlannoUk
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel very much. Checkin & out at reception was swift, efficient & polite. Room was great (albeit tea/cofee making facilities would be nice). Breakfast was excellent. Bar, albeit overpriced, was most pleasant & relaxing. Location is just accross the road from the U-Bahn. All in all - most enjoyable and I shall stay here next time I'm in Berlin. One point though - I booked on the net in advance and got a great deal for 4 nights inc breakfast. If you walk in off the street and get a room - you will be fleeced (and thats without breakfast)!!! Prior planning & all that.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The hotel with its design and decoration is lovely. Very good location in Charlottenburg. The nearest metro station (U-Bahn) is Augsburger Str, Wittenbergplatz, Zoologischer Garten and the shopping street, Kurfürsten strasse, are in a walking distance. Nice swimming pool with sauna and massage area wonderful views from the seventh floor. Very good breakfast. No tea making facilities in the room. The extra 14 Euro charge for wifi per day, or 8 Euro an hour is too expensive, wifi should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Next stay In Berlin will be here again for sure. I like the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fckbst
Reviews.Content: Beautiful design. Surprising audio In a room! Great and tasty breakfast. I just loved it! Next tiime i will stay gladly again In this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JohnAberdeen
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a stylish hotel in the centre of Berlin, this is the place to stay. Big rooms, fab bathroom and amazing shower. I was on the 7th floor and got a room with a balcony...it was a "regular" room, but the size was much bigger that many "executive" rooms in other hotels. It was great value for money compared to other hotels which are nearby. Its convientent for shopping and for the nighlife in Scheonberg. I have my next stay booked already!....roll on Easter!

Reviews.Title: “Sana Berlin Hotel 25-11-2011 to 28-11-2011”
Reviews.Author: daveashton1961
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Sana Berlin Hotel. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left we had a fabulous time. The staff was always friendly and helpful, the breakfasts we delicious and the hotel was spotlessly clean. When we arrived we were asked if we wanted one of the quieter rooms at the back however I didn’t think the hotel was noisy anywhere and think it is a nice quiet spot. There is access to the U-bahn system, and subsequently S-bahn also, just across the road. We found the hotel and staff to be brilliant. We will definitely go back to this hotel and recommend it to anybody

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: Svensk1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a girl's weekend away, and it was really good value, nice big rooms, friendly staff and the location is good. Not the most exciting area, but very quiet and close to the u-bahn. We were 4 girls and got connecting rooms which was a bonus. The value for money was great, although the breakfast was quite overpriced at 18 euros (there are quite a few cute little cafes nearby to go to instead). The staff was really friendly and helpful and helped us finding restaurants and even doing the bookings for us. There is also a swimmingpool and small gym at the top floor that was very nice and quiet when we were there. The only down side were the mirrors in the bathroom, they looked very funky and cool but you couldn't actually see yourself properly in them as the lighting was quite dimmed and they were more like a reflection. I would definitley recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good modern hotel near Zoo station”
Reviews.Author: rogerdmills
Reviews.Content: Very good value 3 person apartments (1 double bedroom , 1 single, 2 bathrooms) which will stretch to 5 if you use the sofa bed in the lounge/ kitchen. Quiet area close to Zoo station so easy access to Airport and East Berlin. Excellent Portugese restaurant in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tuga2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and used it as a base to explore the city. The location is good, altough there are many hotels with location as good as this one. The value for money was very good. Very comfortable room and nice spa facilities

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in unexciting neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: RWinkels
Reviews.Content: Luxurious room with bathroom hidden behind large mirror wall, good minibar, great tv, large bath, good bed, the works! friendly staff. no free internet though... Neighbourhood not so exciting, especially for berlin these days, but subway stop closeby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well positioned and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: talibragg
Reviews.Content: The Sana in Berlin is a modern hotel, my room was comfortable and well furnished and lit. The breakfast buffet was good for €18 and there were always fresh eggs, salmon and fruit being brought out. I have three issues with the hotel. Firstly, internet is not free , it is €14 for 24 hours of WiFi access. Secondly, the doors slam with quite some noise and from 8am on a Saturday morning there was a cacophony of doors slamming that made me regret not wearing ear plugs! Thirdly, the TV channels in my room were not as promised by the hotel's own TV guide, it was as if someone had de-tuned half of the channels. None of these three issues would deter me from staying in the Sana Berlin again, provided I had ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Efficiency in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: the_gh0strider
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel short after the opening... and i must admit it was a surprise as I have never stayed in one of the Sana hotels before. Stylish , straightforward, service orientated and very good located offers the hotel everything a business traveler needs these days. The rooms were clean and quite spacious... The breakfast buffet was quite small but always full even there were a lot people around as it was fair time. The service was always on spot and did whatever they could do with even a huge crowd.... I personally like the lounge bar... and the service was friendly and had always a story to tell.... Just three things are to mention which are slightly negative... the TV seems to need a special treatment that it shows what you want to see... needed to push many times the button of the remote control to switch one time.... another thing are the toilets which you have to locate when you are guest at the bar or lounge... they are at the basement and difficult to find and then attention the design can easily lead you to run into a wall or a mirror...;)...and the huge windows make you sometimes feel you are naked in the room ( which means everyone can see you from the outside)...but it is obviously not the case... it is just the feeling....

Reviews.Title: “Sublime”
Reviews.Author: Neathguy68
Reviews.Content: From the time we entered the hotel we felt welcome, despite arriving almost 2 hours before check-in time. We were greated with a warm & courteous welcome and told that our room was ready. The room itself was spotlessly clean, the layout flowed and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever experienced in a hotel. Could not fault the staff, the room or the facilities

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully modern hotel with theft problem”
Reviews.Author: Melissa1020
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Berlin at the end of a three week European holiday while visiting some friends. Prior to arrival, we were traveling in Italy where we picked up some beautiful bottles of wine, which we were planning on taking home with us. Our first impressions of the hotel were very good. It really is a beautiful and modern hotel with comfortable rooms. However, on our last day in Berlin, we departed in the morning and did not return to later that night, only to discover that the two bottles of wine were taken from our room. We immediately went to the front desk to report the problem and see if the bottles were accidentally removed by the housekeeping staff. The only way to describe the staff's response is flippant. Although nice (smiling faces), they dismissed this as if it was no problem at all saying "if we find them, we'll send them to you." My husband and I are reasonable people and understand that at the end of the day, it's just wine. However, what is really bothersome is the manner in which the staff handled the fact that someone had actually stolen/taken from our room without our consent. Which they basically acted like it was no big deal. I didn't really know how to take this. We have traveled the world and have never had anything taken from our room. Upon our return home, my husband even emailed their headquarters to convey the problem we had and after over a week, we still have no response. After a wonderful trip, and frankly, a wonderful stay at Sana despite the wine theft, this trip ended poorly, and we will never return to a Sana hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel. Very unusual room design.”
Reviews.Author: millymilly13
Reviews.Content: A very stylish, modern and minimalist hotel. Staff lovely and very helpful, Lots of choice at breakfast, hot and cold. The room design looked great at first appearance, very fresh, bright and comfortable bedding etc; however the bathroom had a glass wall and although the shower cubicle and wc were behind a sliding door, it didn't feel very private. Fine if you are travelling alone. A couple of minor issues re lighting and mirrors - if you like to wear make-up, i'd pack a little travel mirror. On a more positive note though, previous reviews mention the Air con. I think this must have been resolved because we stayed here during a very hot few days in August, and were able to control the temperature quite easily. Great links to public transport, Hotel is only about 50m across the road from Augsburger station or a 10 walk from Zoologischer Garten Railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design hotel but things to improve !”
Reviews.Author: AmaurySpe
Reviews.Content: Very nice design room, feels really homy ! i stayed there for 10 days and totally loved it ! i had a little balcony, very nice room on the 6th floor. Amazing bed with loads of pillows (6!) in different sizes from small to XL ! Found kinda strange that you have to pay for your room at checkin + 100 euros for the things you're gonna spend in the hotel (you get it back in cash if you dont spend it). Internet isnt free and can be quite pricey when you stay 10 days !!! (around 70 euros). We got offered breakfast for 12 euros instead of 17 at checkin but at checkout it was 24 because we had double rooms (but we were one per room!) so we had to discuss that with the manager. The room was looking clean and tidy but under the bed there was a lot of garbage (bottles and chocolate bar wrappings) from the previous person staying there. Had to call reception for them to come, check and collect it. I was working in the room when the room service came and i saw how the guy does the bed and put the pillows on the floor, didnt seem really hygienic to me ! Nice gym / pool but sauna and hammam have weird schedules (they're not hot all the time). Breakfast is nice but pricey is you pay 17 euros for it. I think it's good value for Berlin and nice area !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4* (with aircon issues)”
Reviews.Author: Dickie77
Reviews.Content: Good points: 1. Stayed in the Suite on the 7th floor, very large and comfortable. 2 bedrooms, each with own bathroom, plus guest toilet. Separate living room. 2. Very good location, only 5 mins walk from Kurfurstendam and U-bahn just across the road. 3. Very good breakfast. 4. Excellent service. 5. Like the electric blinds! Not so good points: 1. Totally ineffective air conditioning. During our stay, temp in Berlin was c.20c, but room was far too hot without having windows open all night. Corridor outside the room must have been close to 30c. Please Sana, fix your air conditioning! Would not like to stay in the hotel during hot weather. 2. No coffee making facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Strange concept but overall excellent”
Reviews.Author: CraigZurich
Reviews.Content: The Sana is one of these modern hotels which has all the rooms and windows on the outside and a dark central corridor. Then this designer theme is carried through to the rooms with the previously mentioned transparent glass partition between the bathroom and bedroom. I don't much care for it, although the positive aspects of the hotel outweigh the strange concept. First game is to work out which of the wooden panels can be opened. There is a wardrobe, shelves and minibar in there when you find them. Next game is to find which of the light switches provide some useful light, eg the hidden strip light behind the bed. Grumbles over the airconditioning now works no problems there. Big modern rooms for a fair price. Quiet suburban locations, some noise but not enough to keep me awake. Staff good, varying levels of English. Superb breakfast with lots of different choices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but some flaws”
Reviews.Author: KandDReading
Reviews.Content: Good location right near U3 station and a short walk to the lively Kurferstendamm boulevard. There are a couple of flaws to this fairly new hotel, one major drawback is no air conditioning. The hotel is located on the corner of a busy intersection. The only way to ventilate the room. Was in was o open the window, cue noise, raised voices, sirens etc, get up and shut the window then the temperature rises quickly. Not a problem probably for most of the year but a big problem during spring / summer. I don't think the amount of LOw Voltage lighting helps as the heat losses from these lamps are immense, I swear there was a heat haze when you got out of the lift. The swimming pool and sauna were out if action during our stay and we were offered free wifi and a drink from the bar as compensation. I didn't mind that really as we were out and about most of the time. One last small but painful Flaw, beware, the beds are really low with the frame being oversized for the mattress as a result you WILL bang your shins on the sharp edges. Overall, staff were friendly and as a location it tips the balance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not in summertime!”
Reviews.Author: Henrique S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sana Hotel Berlin in June, for 3 nights and the staff is friendly and nice. They even gave me an upgrade for the room I had booked. However, above the first floor, the environment becomes very hot because the A/C does not work. Inside the room the temperature is above 25 degrees centigrade and we must open the windows, wich becomes rather unconfortable and noisy. They put a duvet cover on the bed (as everywhere in Germany) but we could hardly sleep with the sheet only, due to the heat in the room. Another remark is on the food in the Restaurant: - Breakfast is good and very pleasant. However, for dinner, they say in the menu that the food is Portuguese and that is a complete deception, because it is misleading: - the food is French type, as a "Nouveau Cuisine", and although the names are Portuguese, the way of cooking and the typical aspects of the Portuguese food are very far from being found in there.

Reviews.Title: “Concept of excellence hotel ....”
Reviews.Author: 120jenny
Reviews.Content: The mission statement of the hotel "concept of excellence". One of the most efficient hotels i have stayed in. Good location just a few yards away from the underground Augsburger Strasse. It was easy to get into the centre of Berlin from the hotel, the transport system in Berlin is so efficient - everything is so simple and easy to do from buying the tickets to getting on the right train - London transport could learn a few lessons. Back to the hotel, the check-in was hassle free, the room was amazing - nice large comfy bed, fab bathroom with a glass wall to the bed room - though this was a bit odd to start with but it was nice as i didnt feel cut off from the bedroom when i was brushing my teeth I could still watch the tv! All double rooms offer the same - we got a good deal from Booking.com - the cost of the room directly from the hotel is some 480 euro per night, this is too expensive for what you get. The breakfast was excellent, choice of food good - there was something for everyone. The waiting staff were warm and friendly and again very efficient. I would recommend this hotel, though reserve a room through Booking,com.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous oasis in West Berlin”
Reviews.Author: bluedivision
Reviews.Content: One of the best things that can happen to a business traveler is to find yourself in a place that exceeds the expectations and makes you feel at home. This little jewel in West Berlin has just opened, and proves that good service and good staff is not a matter of stars; it is a matter of pride on what you do. Everyone at the hotel is smiling and ready to help you with anything. Great bar, great restaurant, wonderful location, and clean and comfortable rooms. Great attention to detail both in facilities and service standards. I was able to stay at a well priced Jr. Suite, and I highly recommend these corner units. They are extremely large and feature a great master bathroom and extra half bath, plus a nice size living room space, although open to the bedroom. My only criticism is that the gym is almost non existent, and features a very small pool and shared sauna and steam room. I wish it was a bit bigger. Overall, probably the best four star hotel I have stayed at. Made a long week stay feel short. Excellent location, close to major sites in West Berlin and easy to move around from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Much ado of nothing”
Reviews.Author: Ekaterine
Reviews.Content: Was really disaponted with personeel. Though the locaction and rooms are rather good, still the personal is a disaster. They left a trainee on the reception so that she couldn't manage any issue properly. She charged incidentals from both me and my friend while usually that's done for a room. On check out they said the amount to be sent back onto the card the same day though on the receit it was written 30 days and!!!! that's a week already and still not 170 Euro back! On my request with a call to the reception to bring an iron their trainee promise dto call back. She called back in an hour mostly and said.... that all the irons taken by other guests... Next day when i asked for an rion again at the reception another guy told me that irons are not allowed in! Ok, i'm really ok with hotels' rules but i do want the personnel to be consistent in what they are doing or saying!!! By the way, they denied to provide me with the password for Internet and even when i explained that ready to pay whatever, still the trainee said that's impossible!!! Only in the public area! I showed to her on my iPhone that they have got wi-fi facilities but she obviously didn't undetsant what was that!!!! Still i cannot deny the fact the loaction is really good as well as the interior of the room seemed to be nice. But what i dislike about the hotels is a poor level of towels! I would never be able to understand why thet cannot spend one eurp more for REALLY GOOF towles!!! No slippers, no bathrobes though we were staying in a junior suite. I do not think i would stay in it again.

HotelInfo.Name: SANA Berlin Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Nuernberger Str. 33-34, 10777 Berlin, Germany
